definition: position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: They took up a berth near the harbor.
sentences.chinese: 一艘轮船在码头泊位停泊。

sentences.english: I'm informed to shift my ship to the anchorage and wait for a free berth.
sentences.chinese: 我被通知把我的船开到锚地等候空泊位。

sentences.english: Your berth will be clear at 0830 UTC.
sentences.chinese: 你的泊位将在协调世界时0830时清爽。

sentences.english: In terms of transportation, Hainan has 17 ports and 59 berths.
sentences.chinese: 在交通方面，海南已建成港口17个，泊位59个。

sentences.english: For now, however, the billionaire yacht owners of the world will have to fight for parking spaces.
sentences.chinese: 然而眼下，全世界的亿万富豪船主们还是得争抢泊位。

sentences.english: A steamship moored to its berth at the pier.
sentences.chinese: 一艘轮船在码头泊位停泊。

sentences.english: We berthed our ship at dusk.
sentences.chinese: 黄昏时分我们在泊位停船。

sentences.english: We berthed our ship at dusk.
sentences.chinese: 你们得将船停下，港口没有泊位了。

sentences.english: Notes : Four berths of Container Terminal 9 have come into operation in 2004.
sentences.chinese: 九号货柜码头其中四个泊位已于二零零四年开始运作。

definition: parking spot/unloading point/garage place/stand for taxi
to park (a car etc)/to moor (a boat etc)/to leave sth (in a place)
(of a car, ship, train etc) to enter
